modules.title: In 1839, after almost half of the old Duchy of Luxembourg was ceded to Belgium, and the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg remained a mere 2,589 km2 as territory, 169,920 inhabitants were counted.
modules.subheading: This is the story of how and why people moved in and out from Luxembourg, narrated through numbers.

paragraphs.text: Increase right after the first world war.

modules.title: Since 1839, Luxembourg has always been a country of migration(s)
modules.subheading: An emigration country up to the 1900s and an immigration country from de interwar period onwards

paragraphs.text: Since 1839, Luxembourg has always been a country of migration(s): an emigration country up to the 1900s and an immigration country from de interwar period onwards
Luxembourg was plagued by a Cholera pandemic in 1865. More than 3,546 people died in less than 2 years.
paragraphs.source: Pandemics before coronavirus: Cholera, Black Death, Spanish Flu in Luxembourg

paragraphs.text: A relatively big number of families start entering the country. More and more births are registered
Before the first wolrd war. More men than women. A drop of number of births

modules.title: Lxembourg wasn't immune to overseas appeal...

paragraphs.text: Luxembourg wasn't immune to overseas appeal. At the beginning of the 1900, transatlantic ships opened the way to the US and to other overseas country.

paragraphs.text: Les départs tendent cependant plutôt à diminuer légèrement au cours des années 1960, puis se stabilisent jusqu’au milieu des années 1990.
La crise des années 1975-1985 se répercute sur les migrations (chute des arrivées et ce sont surtout les Portugais qui jouent le rôle d'ajustement)
